page.title: 14The Cattle Market in Banbury
page.content: In the cattle market the main animals sold are cows, pigs and sheep. The cows are kept both inside and out depending how much room they have. Each cow has a clip in its ear with a number on. They were bleeding when we went to visit,but it didn't hurt the cows. The numbers of the cows are stored in a computer. There is quite a bit of computerised equipment around the cattle market. The cows have quite a bit of space for themselves. The pigs are kept inside all the time because they do not like hot weather. Above the pigs' pens there are water sprays to spray on in the summer. The biggest pigs are kept to one side of the building ready to be sold. The smallest pigs are kept in pens four metres square with twenty at the most in a pen. These are male and female together.
